subject: Converting custom TestCase to JUnit 4.0
msgSnippet: Hi, I have a functional test which looks roughly like this: public class FunctionalTest extends TestCase { public static Test suite () throws Exception {
messageBody:
Hi,

I have a functional test which looks roughly like this:

public class FunctionalTest extends TestCase {
public static Test suite () throws Exception {
Database db = getDb(); // impl. omitted
TestSuite suite = new TestSuite ();
final double[] results = codeToBeTested(db); // impl. omitted
final double[] expected = getResults(db); // impl. omitted
for (int i = 0; i<results.length; i++) {
suite.addTest(new AccuracyTest(results[i], expected[i]));
}
return suite;
}
}

class AccuracyTest extends TestCase {
private final double result, expected;
public AccuracyTest(double result, double expected) {
this.result = result;
this.expected = expected;
}

@Override
protected void runTest() {
assertEquals(result, expected, 0.01);
}
}

I understand that I can do my database setup in a method tagged
@BeforeClass. But what about the rest? I don't understand how I'm
supposed to create tests about which I don't know everything at
compile time (principally, I don't know the length of the results
arrays). Am I supposed to create a custom Runner? Custom Description?
Note that I want to have one test per element of the array, not to
fail on the first mismatch between "result" and "expected".

Hope you can help!
R
